title: Malay Traditional Science and Machine Learning-Based Project Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Project connecting traditional residential culture of Jambi, Indonesia (Malay traditional houses/cooking) with modern science, utilizing smartphone-based data collection tools

learning_goals: Learners can build ≥3 datasets reflecting the physics principles (balance/gravity/materials science) of Malay traditional housing (longhouse/Malay-style houses), analyze core design patterns using machine learning models (regression/classification), and generate ≥2 insight-driven visualizations via tools like Matplotlib/Tableau.
Pattern derivation of thermodynamic phenomena occurring in the cooking process of regional traditional foods using data mining techniques.

Within a 2–4 week process, learners can develop ≥1 text-based predictive model reflecting cultural contexts (regional language patterns, customs), achieving ≥75% accuracy and fairness metrics (bias score ≤0.2), and document results in an evaluation report.

resources: Case Studies of Malay Traditional Science
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
